items.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

items.school: University of San Diego School of Law Paralegal Program
bullets: Coursework: Civil Litigation, Legal Research and Writing, E-Discovery, Business Entities, Contract Law, and Wills, Trusts, and Estates
Practical Assignments: Conducted legal research and citation, used legal software, drafted estate documents, constructed trial calendars
Thesis: Foreign Powers and Coercive Trade in Antiquity

items.title: IP Paralegal Intern
bullets: Created a trademark maintenance schedule for the year 2027, and wrote a program to complete the task automatically for future use, saving time and increasing efficiency in the office.
Researched and analyzed Office action refusals under §§2(d) and 2(e) and identified successful response strategies based on prior firm filings.
Performed USPTO TESS trademark clearance searches and leveraged generative AI to build targeted, progressively refined regex search strings to improve search accuracy.

Investigated and briefed supervising attorney on jurisdiction-specific requirements for international IP assignments, including notarization, legalization, POAs, and apostille requirements in Central and South America.
Wrote articles concerning copyright and generative AI, transformative use, and digital library sourcing.
Reviewed, annotated, drafted, and organized legal documents including assignment agreements and cease and desist letters under supervision, providing accuracy and dependability.

items.title: Freelance Web Developer & Consultant
bullets: Delivered secure, process oriented solutions for professional clients.
Maintained strict confidentiality under NDA agreements, reflecting sensitivity to proprietary and intellectual property concerns.
Maintained and organized records, invoices, and project files across multiple platforms.
Produced 300+ hours of instructional video content for an international technology team, ensuring technical accuracy and adherence to brand standards.

items.title: Secondary Latin Teacher, Department Head
bullets: Directed a team of 5 teachers, coordinating complex schedules, documentation, and compliance with institutional standards.
Developed, revised, and proofed structured lesson plans, assessments, and reporting systems, ensuring accuracy, version control, and adherence to policy.
Oversaw data tracking and performance reporting for 200 students annually, producing records and summaries for review by administrators and stakeholders.
Delivered instruction in hybrid programs during COVID, requiring adaptation of materials for multiple platforms, accurate record keeping, and effective correspondence.

groups.label: Research & Writing
items: Strong analytical and reasoning skills developed through teaching and legal practice
